comment_text: Thanks for the kind words everyone!! Lauren is awesome (and hello, those glasses? right?) and I'm equal parts excited and jealous about her upcoming forays into the worlds of snail sex and cat tongues... Stay tuned! As for me, I'm having a great time in podcast-land. Thanks everyone for watching and for being part of the Deep Look community!
Lauren is wonderful, and we all love Deep Look. It's fantastic!

I stumbled across the Deep Look Channel a few weeks ago and fell in love with Lauren Sommer's voice.  I have been reading a few of the comments below and will now have to find Amy Standen's podcast, two soothing female voices are a wonderful thing!  I can't wait to hear more of both ladies' presentations!!  It's the little things in life that make an old man like me happy.
Lauren got the best voice for this show.

It's funny that a relatively minor (like, really minor) change in our lives throws us off-kilter.and upsets us. These four minute videos come out twice a month. That's 8 minutes out of 480 waking hours. I don't think it's an overreaction, though. It just goes to show how valuable those eight minutes are to us. Especially now, I think, it's a welcome respite from an increasingly turbulent world.

That said... welcome Laura! Looking forward to those dulcet tones.

Hi All! We know change is hard, and thanks for all the welcoming words for Lauren. All is well with Amy. We think Amy is terrific, and she still works with us here at KQED. She is making a change to dedicate more time to Season Two of her wondferful podcast, The Leap: https://ww2.kqed.org/news/programs/the-leap/ . Lauren is a friend and a colleague who we've worked with for years - she is an amazing host too!
